objects.description: APT28 used other victims as proxies to relay command traffic, for instance using a compromised Georgian military email server as a hop point to NATO victims. (Citation: FireEye APT28) The group has also used a tool that acts as a proxy to allow C2 even if the victim is behind a router. (Citation: Bitdefender APT28 Dec 2015)

external_references.description: Bitdefender. (2015, December). APT28 Under the Scope. Retrieved February 23, 2017.
FireEye. (2015). APT28: A WINDOW INTO RUSSIA’S CYBER ESPIONAGE OPERATIONS?. Retrieved August 19, 2015.
